intro: Trichotosia sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak trichotosia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. Trichotosia sarawakensis is often found in moist, shaded environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
